weather_report:
Early afternoon in Katy wears a soft, changeable sky: the morning’s overcast has loosened into broken clouds, letting shy, silvery sunlight slip through. The day looks clear enough for long views yet a touch matte around the edges, as if seen through frosted glass. Expect more of this gentle back-and-forth through the afternoon—periods of muted sun, then a veil of cloud—pleasant rather than dramatic. The December sun sits low and mild; UV will be on the gentle side, edging toward moderate when the brighter gaps open.

Dress for easy comfort: light layers, a breathable long-sleeve or a thin sweater, a jacket if you run cool, and sunglasses for those sudden bright patches. It’s a day for small, unhurried things—an unambitious walk around the block, a swing by the bakery, tidying the porch, wrapping a few gifts near a window where the light drifts in and out. If you linger outdoors, a touch of sunscreen won’t go amiss, even with the cloud cover.
